According to the law of mass action, it states that the rate of chemical equation is directly proportional to the product of the active mass of the reactants, with each active mass term raised to the power equal to its respective
For ionic reactants, rate of reaction is fast, as activation energy is zero for these. Molecules have a slower reaction rate as they require higher activation energy.
The instantaneous rate of reaction i.e., rate of reaction at any instant of time is the rate of change of concentration of any one of the reactants or products at that instant of time.
